title: Can we change a dependency (adding an un-related variant or *flags) without recompiling dependents?
body:
Is there a way to "change" a package underlying a long chain of dependencies, without recompiling the whole chain, e.g. because of a missing small compilation detail?

### Rationale

On a new HPC cluster, I installed some common scientific packages requested, openmpi and on top of it other packages.  
Then I noticed I forgot to build openmpi with support to PBS (and I faced issue #10542).  
The packages depending on openmpi compiled correctly, since they didn't need that feature, and I've only noticed the missing feature when submitting a test job to a queue.

### Description

Is there a (automatic) way to "substitute" a package to another? I guess not, because spack builds everything with rpath, so manually changing the hashes in the index file and in `.spack/spec.yaml` packages wouldn't have been sufficient. Adding a symbolic link from the openmpi-dir-without-the-feature to the openmpi-dir-with-the-feature may have solved.

Have you ever faced this issue? Did you manage to solve it without recompiling the whole chain?

PS: I've seen #2247 only when I've already done writing this. I don't know whether this is related, and that thread has lots of links, and is now 3 years old.
Are there any news?
